word_mean: 〔复neuroses〕神经机能病，神经〔官能〕症：一种机能性精神紊乱，自我对现实的判断力完好(相反，精神病患者则有缺陷)，主要症状为自我失谐，如强迫观念、焦虑发作、恐怖症和躯体性转换症
一精神分析学说，认为有种特殊的病因学过程，不仅可引起上述各神经症，而且还能引起人格失常(所谓神经症的特有个性)和某些精神紊乱。无意识的矛盾，如相悖的想法或受禁的幼稚愿望，可导致一种忧患无意识地早现(焦虑体验)，这又加剧矛盾(心理)
焦虑可作为激发无意识防范机制的信号，这种机制的效果对于清醒的人和旁观者来说就是神经症或病理

sentence.Network_en: He may have some kind of neurosis or psychosis later in life.
sentence.Network_cn: 他晚年可能患有某种神经症或精神病。

sentence.Network_en: She got a neurosis about chemicals and imagined them everywhere doing her harm.
sentence.Network_cn: 她对化学品有神经症，认为它们无处不在地伤害着自己。

sentence.Network_en: He was anxious to the point of neurosis.
sentence.Network_cn: 他焦虑得都要得神经症了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 神经病（neurosis）又称神经官能症，或精神经症（psychoneurosis），是一组轻性神经功能障碍疾病的总称。神经病可分神经衰弱、 …
神经症及癔症第一节概述神经症（neurosis），旧称神经官能症，是一组主要表现为焦虑、抑郁、恐惧、强迫、疑病症状或神经衰弱症 …
神字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 神经错乱〖 moonstruck〗 神经官能症〖 neurosis〗 神经末梢〖 nerveending;nerveend〗.
neurosedyn 酞胺哌啶酮neurosis 神经官能症; 神经机能病; 神经症-

list.abs: 摘要: 概述抑郁性神经症（depressive neurosis）又称心境恶劣障碍。指一种以持久的心境低落状态为特征的神经症，常伴有焦虑、躯体不适感和睡眠障碍，患者有.
war hawk 好战分子war neurosis 战争神经症warble 颤音
焦虑性神经症（焦虑性神经症(anxiety neurosis)简称焦虑症）1．病因
compulsive masturbation 强迫性手淫compulsive neurosis 强迫神经症compulsive personality 强迫型人格

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: modern Latin, from neuro- 'of nerves' + -osis

entry.def: Neurosis is a mental condition which causes people to have unreasonable fears and worries over a long period of time.

example.ex: He was anxious to the point of neurosis...
example.tran: 他焦虑得都要得神经症了。

example.ex: She got a neurosis about chemicals and imagined them everywhere doing her harm.
example.tran: 她对化学品有神经症，认为它们无处不在地伤害着自己。

means.word_mean: 1. a mental or personality disturbance not attributable to any known neurological or organic dysfunction

auth_sentence.content: But he didn't seem particularly afflicted with this neurosis.
auth_sentence.res_content: But he didn't seem particularly afflicted with this neurosis.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he didn't seem particularly afflicted with this neurosis.

auth_sentence.content: He found at the core of their neurosis a sense of insecurity.
auth_sentence.res_content: He found at the core of their neurosis a sense of insecurity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He found at the core of their neurosis a sense of insecurity.

auth_sentence.content: TV, she says, can breed neurosis if you're not careful.
auth_sentence.res_content: TV, she says, can breed neurosis if you're not careful.

sentences.en: the director’s neurosis about actors arriving late for filming
sentences.cn: 道演因演员拍片迟到的神经紧张
